reviews.review_msg: Lectures started off good, kind of devolved into random off-topic subjects within the first few weeks. Midterms are pretty close to the quizzes, she even pops in a couple super easy questions for free marks basically. Lon capa is horrendous though, and the textbook questions are insanely hard after chapter 3. Be prepared to self study a lot.
Do end of chapter questions to study for exams. Her lectures are good and I think some curving happened at the end.
doesn't actually teach material, tells random personal anecdotes. showed up half an hour late to midterm exam leaving us with only a half hour to do the exam.

Goyan was the most caring professor I've ever had! Lectures and practice problems recorded, which helped a lot. She answered every single student's question, and gave so much time if you asked for it. I took this course 3 times, passed with her. Says it all. I couldn't believe the other reviews, made an account just to say how fantastic she is.

Lecture slides were overly long and not useful. While she seemed nice and caring, teaching could have been better. Lab reports were graded very strictly with little time to finish. No clear grade outline until the end of semester, and exams were overly long and theory based despite practical focus in class and on assignments. Would not recommend.

She scaled the class down by A LOT for reference an 81 is a C+. We had no idea before the final that this was a possibility so I didn't put as much effort on the final as I had harder ones that same week. Went into the final with 92%. She isn't very approachable either. Avoid taking with her!

Exams are very difficult. Many questions were ones that I weren't familiar with, despite doing hundreds of textbook questions, every lecture question and practice exams. She's an alright teacher with a bubbling personality but this does not outweigh the difficulty at all.

As a person, she's great. She's funny and you can tell she cares, but she isn't the most amazing professor. She does a poor job of explaining certain concepts. She's very smart and I think maybe it's hard for her dumb it down to the "first-year--level". Tests and exams were also often unreasonable and unrealistic, with a lot of trick questions.

She graded me and my friends lab, she guided us through it, we gave back the reports and she gave it back to us the same day, Received a 1 out of 30. Both of us. Makes zero sense for her to do this. Extremely tough grader because what the flip.

She comes off as warm and friendly in lectures, but she is by far the most incompetent educator I have ever had. She makes lots of mistakes in lectures, slides are extremely long, getting grades back is more complicated than it needs to be, tutorials are a mess (and sometimes AI generated). If you're a more independent student you'll be fine.

absolutely diabolical. Literally went to vegas the week of our first midterm and didnt answer any emails and cancelled lectures during that week. extremely unorganized. grades always turned in super late so you cant even use them to prepare for next test. no. just no.

- downcurved last minute
- was rude to both students and her assistants 
- very disorganized 
- changed labs last minute
- marked our practical unfairly 
- hard to communicate in her emails 
- softcore bullies her own students when we needed help 
- snarky 

take this course with someone else.
She doesn't help students and was sometimes rude. I wouldn't take this class with her.
She doesn't help at all and is disorganized. Take it with another professor if possible.
Do not recommend

DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASSES WITH HER. She does not help the students whatsoever and is rude. If it weren't for the TAs I wouldn't have survived. The grading scheme is very weird and the cut off for an A- is 89%. If it weren't for that I would've gotten a A-. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH SOME OTHER PROF IF POSSIBLE.

The material isn't that hard, the curving was the worst idea, not everyone got the grade that they deserve. She is rude when you ask questions and usually is wrong herself.  Asking a question makes you more confused, which does discourage students from going up to her from help. TAs understood the material better than her..

Disorganized and unable to guide students/class properly (TAs carry every lab). Comes to labs late. Spends the first 15 to 40 minutes of the lab trying to give directions but ends up yapping. Gave the class a bonus assignment (originally not a bonus) then scaled everybody's grades back.
She is however, very lenient since the class is often a mess.

Very unclear grading scheme. She most likely changed it after the final because the averages were "too high". Minimum A- percent was 89%, not 85%. This was not specified anywhere before the final, nor was it specified until asked about. She loves to poke fun at students who ask her for help in her labs. She's overall a terrible instructor.
Was quite upset that she backscaled the entire class' grades down rather than providing people with the grade they earned.

Bad prof. Minimal material to prepare for Labs and Exams. Final exam was poorly formatted due to the fact that she wrote it at 3am. Her prelab talks are long and unnecessary, spending most her time talking about her kids and flexing her 6 figure salary on 18/19 year olds. Grades were 2 weeks late because the election was too interesting. Very lazy!

Took at least an hour to talk every lab, yet was strict on us finishing the lab early, the report sheets were marked fairly, but the final exam - which was written at 3am, in the worst format imaginable, was not. She curved us all down, and by the way does not curve up. And gave a bonus assignment just to regret it? Avoid if possible

She had changed the grading scale last minute because “the bonus assignment was worth too much”; she thought it would be best to make it harder to receive an A in this course to combat the weight of said assignment. We emailed her about this; she stated that she would not be responding to emails until the next term. Unprofessional at the least.

It's been 2 weeks since final grades were due by the dean still haven't gotten our grades back. She had to scale down in this class class average is 83 and so she made class average a b instead of a b+ like Surrey. Wtf is this man

She yaps for an hour and expects you to finish on time. There is a lot of students who don't. She made the final exam at 3 AM in the morning of when we were supposed to take it. It was the worst exam format I have ever seen e.g. having to explain the multiple choice section why it was right and every other option was wrong. Highest final mark was⬇️

Very disorganized, lab reports are marked fair because most of the time they are marked by the TAs, whenever she marks expect to almost fail. She openly admitted to being weak in electrochem, having to teach herself every semester before she teaches it. Took way too long to get our marks back after grades cutoff and sent us an email of excuses.

When I say skip please just wait another semester. Profs like this should not be allowed. Final grades are due tn. She emailed us with 6 excuses for all the 6 days she had to mark it. The dean is pissed at her apparently. Instead of admitting she has poor time management she had a “dance recital”, “technical issues”. She then blames the TA's
She is super unorganized and completely closed to any feedback, even when it's clear from all the mess in her classes...

Honestly avoid chem 126 with rebecca at all costs!! for a 2 credit course your workload is on par with a 3 or 4 credit course. Her labs are confusing, even the TA's were confused. The final was extremely difficult and she did not provide adequate information or give pre exam prep.

Where  do we begin. She spends 1st hour of lab talking about her personal life. She changes the lab last minute to confuse us. She comes to lab hours late and doesn't do a pre lab. I think she means well but sometimes she doesn't idk. It feels like she wanted to confuse you and doesn't have empathy

I was a TA for her for this lab but she's incredibly passive aggressive to the students. I've witnessed students asking her for help, each time I hear her criticize the student rather than help correct them with their mistake. "I don't even get how you made this mistake" is inappropriate. SFU needs to re-evaluate who they hire for this lab.

Very unorganized lab.Spends the 1st hr of lab talking about lab procedures and random personal stories and refuses to use a mic so nobody can even hear what's important or not.Gets mad at first year students for not knowing how to do an expt and is rude if you make a mistake.Passive aggressive when answering questions.Everyone confused even TA's.

Spends forever talking at the beginning of each lab. Minimal lab prep outside of LonCapa, but the techniques are simple enough. Lab work is done in pairs or groups, with her switching up who is paired with who in each row. Each class includes a written report sheet due at the end of lab, but the questions are usually similar to the LonCapa.

Please do not take her if you have other options. For chem 121 I taught myself basically everything. Her slides were taken right off the internet, and they weren't informative enough. Her quizzes were poorly formatted and she gave us little details about them.

Overall Dr. Goyan was a decent professor. She has a ton of resources for extra help and has pre-recorded all of her lectures which is helpful. The lectures can be confusing so it helped a lot that I could go rewatch topics that I didn't understand. She seems to really care about students and made herself available for help often.

as a first year, goyan was tough. chem 122 is NOT CURVED iirc. 830 lecs did not help at all but not her fault. she records ALL her lectures, provides textbook questions + extra practice problems (textbook is free or easily accessible). lecture material was confusing no matter how much i studied and quizzes were fair but also confusing at times?

Dr. Goyan tends to go off topic a lot during her lectures, typically with stories about her life and past experiences. Her lectures are not the worst, some chapters contain lectures that are 100 - 150 slides long so it tends to become tedious when reviewing them. However, all her lectures are recorded so thats a plus. Overall pre mid prof.

CHEM110/111: pre-recorded online lectures were much longer than they needed to be. ended up learning mostly on my own. Lab manuals were extremely confusing and even contradictory at times. Had 4 hours to finish the lab, and most of it was just spend trying to figure out instructions, calculating standard deviation, or listening to her stories.

Girl is wack, like literally. Online course material was pretty breezy if you keep up with the weekly assignments and recordings. but my god when it came to labs she was all over the place and so were students. She relatively changed the lab procedure in the process of doing the lab which resulted in redoing the lab and start from scratch.

A lot of material to cover, especially for someone coming from 0 chemistry background. Although there was a lot of weekly assignments (Achieve), just putting in a couple hours and doing them really helped understand the material, especially since you can hand them in late at low consequence.

Prof was very accessible outside of lecture, would rec.

Dr.Goyan is an extremely kind and caring professor. She does stray from the lecture material during lectures, talking about her own experiences and examples, but not to the extent I feel people portray on here. She was always happy to chat about anything, even non-chemistry topics. She is a great prof as long and will do her best to see you do well

Dr Goyan is a pretty good teacher. She's available to help often, teaches the material in a pretty easy-to-understand way (both in lectures and office hours), puts her full slides up for people to read, AND she usually gives a free bonus mark on tests.
Chem 111 had a ton of material to cover, but prof was super accessible outside of class, and her tests were not as hard as people pretend.

Dr. Goyan is very unorganized, has tech issues, and her work was all over the place, making it hard to follow along. She also goes off on tangents in the middle of lectures and so we're unable to finish the notes. 

However, she is accessible outside of class and is there to help. It's true that she tends to get 'creative' on her tests though...

The professor made simple concepts extremely complicated, the exam was a disaster!!!  She provided a problem with 20 questions below, if you can not get the answer the first, YOU CAN NOT do any less of them! Avoid if possible!

So much homework is assigned every week and she never finishes her slides. She rushed through the last week of material and now finals are coming up and she hasn't taught everything. Also, she is constantly talking about her personal life in class.
Horrible, avoid her. Some lectures had 300 slides and she never talked about any homework questions. Always talked about random stuff

Not a great lecturer and cannot convey concepts to make it easy to comprehend. Often talks about her personal issues during lectures which wastes time that we could've spent on understanding her 110+ slides which is filled with info we don't need to know majority of the time. Midterm was fair but the final was horrible/too long to complete

Overall Goyan is a solid Prof, her tests take up most of the % in the class. Final - 45% Midterm-25% 

Lectures can be boring sometimes and her lecture slides aren't the best. Hard to understand her writing and writes extremely fast. She is extremely accessible after class and will help you if you go to her.

Dr Goyan is an okay lecturer. She will explain the material and go on the occasional tangent on some chemistry fact. The course itself covers a lot of material and can become very difficult if you fall behind. If you do all the homework it isn't as bad. The midterm is 40% and final 45%. Dr G gets "creative" with her tests, so beware.
She's a a nice person, but not the best teacher. We were expected to learn a lot if not everything outside of class.

Absolute worst instructor you can have. She skipped like 4 lectures and expected us to learn the material on our own. She makes so many mistakes in lectures and even in pre recorded ones. Spends 60 percent of the lecture blabbering about random stuff. She made mistakes on the midterm and gave no extra time. Whatever you do, avoid her at all costs!!

Had to read the textbook and watch youtube videos to actually understand the material better because the lectures weren't enough. Tests were alright, but she was disorganized. We also never got to see most of our lab reports and only got our lab grades back at the end of the semester, so we never knew how we were doing/how to improve.

Dr. Goyan bent over backwards for us to succeed in the spring and every effort was appreciated, by most. The students who complained during her lectures regarding marking were those who did not pay attention to the course content. Dr. Goyan kept me engaged throughout the entire lecture period and answered any and all questions in depth.

She is a lovely person buts he was just a big mess. She didn't number the midterm question correctly so we had to do that and she wasn't even there. final was chaos and it was all poorly managed. we started late and did not get extra time after and another class came in while we were still doing our exams. So many questions for less 3 hours. AVOID
basically have to teach yourself everything

CHEM 125 is a pretty tough lab course for the first university-level gen chem lab, IMO. Pat close attention to sigfigs and read the lab material BEFORE the lab including the relevant appendix page. You cannot be prepared enough  If you ask for help directly from her it's better because TA's are often unsure what they're allowed to help with.
Super nice prof, pop quizzes sometimes before the lab, and don't forget your sig figs! Grading is pretty clear and you just have to average 50% on your lab write ups to pass the class.

She is nice, enthusiastic. Due to Covid, the class, tutorial isn't mandatory so A LOT homework to do in LonCapa and Achieve, before & after lab. I don't watch her video cause reading textbook and doing quiz on it is enough. The lab is pretty heavy but TA is helpful. Midterm is easy, average is 80. Final is more difficult and heavier. Both are MC.

For my class she was alright. Very accommodating and her exams weren't too hefty, but the Canvas page didn't have a discussion section so if you had an issue you could only really email her and not contact other students.

Hilarious cause she's actually a joke of a professor. Always makes excuses for not answering our emails and not posting assignments on time. If you're too busy then don't teach at the university level. We pay thousands of dollars for people like her to ruin our semesters. I learned more from her TA's and the textbook in one day than her in the sem

Dr. goyan is definitely a nice person and very approachable. She will help you if needed in her office hours. The downside is that her lecture notes barely help you understand the material (you have to learn on your own if you want do well) and she does not provide any feedback on quizzes or exams, so you will never know what you need to work on.

Poor teaching skills. Midterm and final exam average was 50% aprox. EXTREMELY long and hard exams. 3hr long exams and still not enough time to complete the exam. Absolutely no feedback in her class. I understand this is a online course but still no excuse to not provide feedback. Apparently the department is not a big fan of her teaching either.

The fact that you get absolutely zero feedback from all the assignments, quizzes and term tests makes it impossible to plan and improve. Add to that the horrendous loncapa portal + lack of overall structure in this course are designed to make you feel lost. Avoid at all costs I couldn't take this course with Jeff because it was full I know now why

A very nice person, however not a good teacher. All she does is read from the slides and does not make an effort to clearly describe concepts in a more clear and effective way. Online videos/info from others were helpful as hell!
Overall not a bad prof. Has good lectures and is willing to help outside of class. Somewhat disorganized, understand the concepts REALLY well and you will be good.

I have graduated several years ago,I came back here to warn students majoring chemistry If you are taking Chem 266 and Chem 366 with her, good luck with that and don't take too many courses at the same time. 6 extremely long Lab reports ,those topics are outdated. Poor communication, not considerate, vague marking scheme

Dr. Goyan is approachable and adaptable. She has a sense of humour that grew on me throughout the semester and made chem lectures more bearable. There is a lot of homework in this course, but if you are willing to get help (OH) it is not unmanageable. Bottom line, Dr. Goyan wants everyone to succeed, even if she is a little disorganized at times.

I honestly have no clue why these ratings are so low. She is the most approachable prof I have ever had and understands students very well. Yes, she has trouble with technology sometimes, but don't we all? She explains concepts VERY well and she's sincerely a good person. Lots of homework but it's manageable. Textbook required to access homework :)

Dr. Goyan's lectures were good. Considering the online format she kept at a good pace. There was a lot of homework in this course. There was online homework on Lon Capa and Sapling, which adds up. The midterm exam was alright, some hard questions. Need to manage your time well and you'll be okay.

Hands down one of the most disorganized proffs, I have ever taken. Not only disorganized but also unfair, her exam covers nothing from assignments (which makes this course feel like 5 cred instead of 4) and she grades you like you are supposed to know concept she barely covered or tricky questions that look nothing like material covered.

She's a total sweetheart meaning that she has the patience of a saint. Personality aside, she's a prof who will completely understand your position as a student and where your difficulties lies. She's willing to help even when she's really busy, and never loses her cool around you.
The pre-lab questions she has assigned are extremely difficult. It's hard to find information on how to solve the questions both in the textbook and in the lab manual.

Seems like a nice lady. I REALLY wish she would actually do examples in class of certain calculations instead of already having them pre-made on the slides. Also, it would be nice if she could invest in a laser pointer instead of pointing at her lecture notes 50 feet above her with her fingers (really hard to follow along).

Becky was funny, but it seemed like she could not communicate to us, the students, or even the TA's, what was going on in the course. I felt the course was very independent. Every lab required extensive research and I had questions that were essential to complete the report, that no one seemed capable of answering. Would not recommend.

Super passionate about chemistry however she was extremely disorganized and  spent most of the lecture (30-40min) talking about her family. Her exams were fair. I honestly stopped attending lectures after the midterm and still ended up with a B+ for the course. Just make sure you focus on the theories surrounding the main concepts.

The course workload was manageable.However, the prof was so disorganized and not very helpful at all. She was hard to reach and didnt reply to any of my emails. Her notes were confusing because she didnt prepare and make them herself. She released 4 long assignments during the last 3 weeks of the term. Theres a lot of calculations in this course.

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!! Disorganized, doesn't teach the calculations, TA completely useless and doesnt speak any english. Terrible waste of time. Paid for this class and had to teach myself. The calculations on the assignments are hard and you have to figure it out yourself cause they're never taught! Stay away.
riduculous. irresponsible. unresponsive. unenthusiastic. There I said it

I am an arts student taking this course ofor my Q and Sci credit. She is the most unorganized prof on this planet! Can't get anything together. Materiel isn't very hard but she doesn't teach it which makes this simple chemistry very hard! The TA does not speak english and doesnt know anything. I would avoid this class!!!
not ideal

She's passionate about chemistry.She does talk about her family sometimes,but that's because it's chemistry related.First MT was easy, just study the textbook.But really, if you haven't taken ANY CHEM,or is bad at it, the calculations in the final were PRETTY tricky,nothing she taught before.TA was HORRIBLE& slow, she marks so hard for no reason.

I loved this course for the most part. Goyan was great. The material was interesting and applicable. I worked hard and found the midterm very easy. Yes, she likes to talk about her life but does it to relate chemistry to everyday life. I see nothing wrong with that! That said, I didn't think the # of assignments were fair, and our TA was HORRIBLE!

Agree with the other posters, she doesn't lecture about the class at all yet the exams are extremely hard. She told us her life's story every class. She said she got knocked up and her new boyfriend is better than the father of her child?! TMI. She brought her dogs and they're cut but they ran around and freaked people out.
SHE SUCKS AND HER TA， they are unbelievably irresponsible.TOOOOO MUCH PAPER AND Turnitin drive me crazy！！！！！！！！！！！！！！
WORST PORF EVER!!!!!!i should've read the rating before i take the course! WAY TOO MANY PAPERS TAT HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE COURSE!
Absolutely irresponsible. Impossible to contact her after the final exam. You will NOT be able to locate her either through email OR her office.

Hated chem more than ever after taking this. first year course: 6 papers,1 MT,1 final, iclicker....ridiculous, more writing than english + communication courses. By end of semester, we learn more of her laywer brother, pharmacist father, and boyfriend than the course material. i am disappointed in SFU chemisty.

Becky is pretty cool, she's a bit dorky (gets excited about her excited states you might say), but overall a great prof who enjoys what she does and above all wants to see her students succeed.  I feel bad that I had five other classes to focus on while taking her course.. Hopefully she'll teach me again! (Hard Exams)

This class although interesting involved too much work and I found myself actually struggling with the loncapa due in part that she does not teach anything valuable to us or she completely skips over it. The only positive thing is that shes actually really nice and I do have to give her an A+ on that, but teaching wise, a D for sure

WORST PROF EVER.. i read through the ratings prior to taking this class and i thought to myself i will just try harder... i did and it was still the worst possible class i ever took, its suposed to be an easy course turned out to be harder then organic chem.. i saw someone crying after the final exam.. NEVER EVER TAKE A COURSE WITH GOYAN EVERR..

Why is she still allowed to teach? SFU must have pretty low standards. Bad notes, no lecturing (about the course!), impossible exams (because we're not taught anything). I gave her the benefit of the doubt event though I checked here first, but everyone is right..she sucks. Avoid like the plague!! And she really needs to lose the pajamas.

This course has been generally dissapointing, Chem 360 has been by far the most disorganised course I have taken at SFU. Midterm was cancelled night before because she felt "we were not prepared" after we spent the weekend studying. Lon Capa unrelated to course, she couldn't even do all the questions herself. Notes riddled with mistakes. Boo

THANK YOU Prof. Goyan for creating this wonderful course call Chemistry 192. Not only is this a great Q course for us Arts people, but I had never feel so alive and relax in a science course before. The best part is that I got myself an A, the highest grade I EVER got in university. We need MORE courses like Chemistry 192!

Posted Notes are rather disorganized and difficult to comprehend. LON CAPA assignments are completely unrelated to lecture material, however the written assignments are somewhat related. Granted it is one of the more difficult courses at SFU, it is not necessary to make it unbearable. Take this course with another prof. She is very nice though.

She could be a bit clearer about what readings we need to do or when assignments are due, but her demos are usually fantastic to watch and this class is a great choice for the Arts student who needs a science credit.

serious speaking, i learn nothing in this course, even i attend most of the classes. her notes aren'e clear. since the class average is kinda sad, it scaled alot. so yea go ahead take it, its not that bad actually.
Her office is always open to all the students. She is really passionate in teaching.
Great prof. I learned so much from her.

I took this course last summer. The course was hard and the exam was even harder, but she is really helpful and always available to help you. The lab was confusing, thank God for her and the TAs who always running around the comp lab to help the students.

absolutely THE worst prof i have ever had. wasted power points on stupid comics where she could have added more explanations. notes are useless, expects you to memorize text- which is the crappiest book ever. exams were way too long and hard. i finished this class with the same amount of knowledge as i entered. DO NOT TAKE CHEM 215 WITH HER!

Yes, she used someone else's notes which lead to confusion in the lectures at some points. The midterm was killer  she didn't do enough problems in class which lead many to not realize the hardness of the course, the loncapa was hard but this is take home, its expected to be way harder. The final was long and hard, but expected difficulty. Shes Ok.

She not only uses someone else's notes but doesn't even review them before coming to lecture. She reeds off a power point without explaining. Review sessions were pointless because she didn't even know how to solve some of the questions.  Exams were too long and the textbook was so useless I had to refer to my 1st year text for help

Easiest class ever. Lectures have no correlation to the 3 projects required for this class. She is very lenient and I believe she will give everyone a fairly good grade. The textbook was obsolete. Never had to use it. Internet research was all that was required of this course. She is a nice person, though.

Should not be professor at a post-secondary instition. It makes me mad to think that I paid for this class. I learned nothing from her lecture! She wastes my time by telling stories about her stupid dogs, her clarinet quartet, and more. I don't care. I wanted to learn the course material, Dr. Goyan was no help.

Writes very long, difficult, unreasonable exams but has NO right to do so considering her lectures cover a minimal amount of material very poorly. Holds an office hour, but instead of explaining concepts, she prefers to humiliate you by bombarding you with questions you can't answer because of her startlingly sub-par teaching ability in lecture.

Hands down, the worst professor I have ever had. Reads through lecture slides FAR too fast...we finished the course a month BEFORE THE FIRST MIDTERM! And the first (and only) midterm was set to only a month before the final. If you have to take this course avoid taking it with Goyan at all costs, even if it means you have to take it in the summer.
Professor does not teach but reads off a powerpoint slide show. She just zips through 20 slides in 1 lecture. Does not explain calculations at all. This is mostly a self-taught class.
